text: Psalm 45
Celebration of a Royal Wedding
For the \add music\add* director; according to \add The\add* Lilies. Of the sons of Korah.
A maskil. A song of love.\f + \fr Ps 45 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
My heart is moved \add with\add* a good word;
I recite my ⸤compositions⸥\f + \fr 45:1 \ft Literally “works,” that is, the song he has composed \f* to \add the\add* king.
My tongue \add is the\add* pen \add of\add* a skilled scribe.
You are \add the most\add* handsome of \add the\add* sons of humankind;
grace is poured out on your lips;
therefore God has blessed you forever.
Gird your sword on \add your\add* thigh, O mighty one,
\add in\add* your splendor and your majesty.
And \add in\add* your majesty ⸤ride victoriously⸥,\f + \fr 45:4 \ft Literally “Succeed! Ride!” \f*
because of truth and humility \add and\add* righteousness.
And let your right hand teach you awesome deeds.
Your arrows \add are\add* sharp;
peoples fall under you
in the midst of the king’s enemies.
Your throne, O God, \add is\add* forever and ever.
A scepter of uprightness \add is\add*
the scepter of your kingdom.
You love righteousness and hate wickedness.
Therefore God, your God, has anointed you
from among your companions \add with\add* festive oil.
All your robes \add are scented with\add* myrrh and aloes \add and\add* cassia.
From palaces of ivory stringed instruments gladden you.
Kings’ daughters \add are\add* among your noble ladies.
The queen stands at your right hand in gold of Ophir.
Hear, O daughter, and ⸤discern⸥\f + \fr 45:10 \ft Literally “see” \f* and incline your ear,
and forget your people and your father’s house.
Let the king desire your beauty.\f + \fr 45:11 \ft Or “Should the king desire … then bow down …” \f*
Because he \add is\add* your lord, therefore\f + \fr 45:11 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* bow down to him.
Even the daughter of Tyre \add will come\add* with a gift.
\add The\add* rich from among people will seek your ⸤favor⸥.\f + \fr 45:12 \ft Literally “face” \f*
The king’s daughter is all glorious within;\f + \fr 45:13 \ft That is, within her bridal chamber \f*
her garment \add is\add* of gold embroidered cloth.
She is brought to the king \add in\add* colorful garments.
\add The\add* young women behind her, her attendants,
\add are\add* being brought to you.
They are led with joy and gladness.
They enter \add the\add* palace of \add the\add* king.
In place of your\f + \fr 45:16 \ft The pronouns and verbal forms are masculine in this verse \f* fathers will be your sons.
You will make them princes in all the land.\f + \fr 45:16 \ft Or “earth” \f*
I will cause your name to be remembered in all generations;
therefore peoples will praise you forever and ever.
